intro: Hieraciodes stenoma, commonly known as the narrowleaf hieraciodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette, giving it a compact appearance. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it is adapted to survive in dry conditions with minimal water requirements. Its structure and growth habits make it a resilient species often found in rocky or sandy soils.
